alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 5:17AM EST until February 19 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following county, Stark. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 AM EST, automated gauges report flooding across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell on Thursday. - Minor to moderate flooding is occurring across the Nimishillen Creek basin, including the West and Middle Branches of the Nimishillen and Sandy Creek near Waynesburg. Flooding is expected to continue through the morning hours as waters continue to recede across the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canton, Massillon, Green, Alliance, North Canton, Louisville, Minerva, Hartville, Brewster, Navarre, Waynesburg, East Sparta, Wilmot, Canal Fulton, East Canton, Beach City, Meyers Lake, Hills And Dales, Limaville and Perry Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
